name: Hand-Eye Coordination
body: This is a vital skill to learn for anyone who wants to succeed as a batsman.

name: Concentration
body: All players need to work on their concentration levels.

name: Reflexes
body: Quick reflexes are important for batsmen but also for certain fielders, particularly wicket keepers and those who are standing in the slips.

name: Spatial Perception
body: This term relates to awareness of where the ball is coming from and where it’s likely to finish – either in a hitting zone as a batsman or in a catching arc if you are in the field.

name: Sprinting and Agility
body: Batsmen need to be quick between the wickets while fielders also need that pace to chase down balls that are heading to the boundary.

name: Balance
body: Balance is important for a batsman as they need to be in a good position in order to transfer their weight through the ball.
